data.text: @Doctors_NS Instead, we would ask all donors about anal sex in the context of new or multiple recent partners. This would allow us to precisely and reliably identify those who may have a transfusion-transmissible infection, regardless of gender or sexual orientation. (2/2) ^MM

@Doctors_NS Thank you for supporting Canada's Lifeline. If Health Canada approves our submission (made in December 2021), we will no longer ask men if they’ve had sex with another man or ask trans donors about whether they’ve had lower genital gender-affirming surgery. (1/2)
